climbs.name: Synagogue
climbs.fa: Tucker Tech, Phil Bircheff and Alan Bartlett, December 1999

content.description: Begin in a shallow right-facing corner to straight-in crack to reach a ledge, continue up the corner above which pinches down for a bit (this is the R-rated bit) and finish up a chimney. Gear belay and scramble off or rap from bolts atop the highest point of the formation.
content.location:
The prominent right-facing corner just to the left of

Sinagar

; there is currently a bush at the base of the route.

climbs.name: Sinagar
climbs.fa: Reese Martin and John Thackray, April 1986

content.description:
Start up a short right-facing corner, clipping a bolt on the neighboring route if you like, and then work up into a long left-facing corner with some bushes to the top. Gear belay and scramble off or rap from bolts atop the highest point of the formation.

This somewhat obscure route has been mislocated in previous guidebooks; the large right-facing corner to the left is what was thought to be the line.
content.location: Located in the center of the crag and just left of "The Hardest Route in the World".
